result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Andrew Waller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample
AODA and counseling as required by probation, including anger management
No contact with Holly Mevis or her child B.M.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.dispoDesc: This sentence is due to probation being revoked
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Andrew Waller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: State of WI Tax Refund.  Modified out $1.66.
Def's JU,NEJ,NOC to Langlade Co Jail

Defendant Jason Andrew Waller in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Defendant Jason Andrew Waller in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 13CF36 and 15CM179 @ 11:13 a.m. Agreement stated - 15CM179 - Revocation packets received. No corrections by State. Agreement for 6 months jail, credit for 128 days. 13CF36 State moves to revoke DEJ and proceed to sentencing. Agreement for withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow up, court costs. Atty Seifert and Def agree. State explains why agreement is for probation. Def agrees. Statement by Atty Seifert. Court verifies that Def agrees terms of DEJ were violated and sentencing should proceed. State advises has complied with victim rights on 15CM179. Court reviews 13CF36 and verifies that plea colliquy was already done. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court, will follow agreement. 13CF36 sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, court costs - no DNA surcharge, DNA sample. No credit if revoked. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
15CM179 - Court will follow agreement. 6 months jail, credit for 128 days served. Convert outstanding court obligations to civil judgment. Huber. Postconviction rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jason Andrew Waller in court with attorney Zachary Glascock.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 13CF37  @ 9:33 a.m. 13CF37 - Revocation summary has been received. No additions or corrections. State concurs with recommendation in summary. State has complied with victim rights. State presents reasons for agreeing with recommendation - 12 months on ct 2 and 90 days consecutive on ct 3. Credit for 208 days. Response by Atty Glascock - believes credit of 208 days should be on ct 2. Nothing by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court will follow joint recommendation. On ct 2 - 12 months jail w/ credit for 208 days served. Ct 3 - 90 days jail, consecutive to ct 2. Good time according to jail's policies. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Court will allow huber privileges. Court calls 15CM179 @ 9:47 a.m. Same appearances - Special appearance by Atty Glascock. Agreement - Def will plead to charge DC as repeater, withheld sentence, 20 months probation, AODA, counseling, anger management, any other counseling recommended, no contact w/ H.M. or B.M.  State will not move to revoke DEJ in 13CF36, gives reasons.  Atty Glascock has received complaint, reading waived, agree with agreement as stated. Def also agrees. Court reviews plea quest. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Factual basis. Atty Glascock satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. State gives sentencing remarks, has complied with victim rights. Response by Atty Glascock. State reads victim impact statement. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court will adopt agreement. Withheld prison sentence, 20 months probation, AODA and counseling as required by probation, including anger management. No contact with Holly Mevis or her child B.M.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Court costs only. DNA sample and surcharge. Postconviction rights. 13CF36 - State asks DEJ be modified to include successful completion of probation in 15CM179 as condition. No objection. Court approves.

Defendant Jason Andrew Waller in court,via video in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Def has filed request for court appointed attorney.  Def is not eligible for public defender.  Court reviews Court appointed atty form with def.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Andrew Waller in court, in custody & via-video.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 1:41 pm.  Court vacates authorization.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights. Def. has filed a petition for court appointed atty. Court has never received petition. Bond remains.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Andrew Waller not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has signed a signature bond for todays date.  State request warrant $500. bond or body only.  Court so orders
